abstract: James E. Staley, who left JPMorgan Chase this year to join the hedge fund BlueMountain Capital Management, said on a panel at the Bloomberg Hedge Funds Summit that the regulatory changes being developed could present an investment opportunity.
snippet: James E. Staley, who left JPMorgan Chase this year to join the hedge fund BlueMountain Capital Management, said on a panel at the Bloomberg Hedge Funds Summit that the regulatory changes being developed could present an investment opportunity.
lead_paragraph: As the head of JPMorgan Chase‘s investment bank, James E. Staley helped the company navigate the thicket of new regulations that emerged after the financial crisis.

headline.main: After JPMorgan, Staley Sizes Up Banks for Hedge Funds
